DiscordServer.spanish: Entra a nuestro servidor de Discord.

ContributeDescription.english: Contribute in any way you can.
ContributeDescription.spanish: Contribuye en cualquier forma en la que puedas.

creditsDescription.english: List of people that have help out by any way.
creditsDescription.spanish: Lista de personas que han ayudado de cualquier forma.

ModsDescription.english: Mods, Maps and custom campaigns supported in Unity.
ModsDescription.spanish: Modificaciones, Mapas y campaÃ±as personalizadas soportadas en Unity.

Changelog.english: List of changes made to the repository. (English only)
Changelog.spanish: List de cambios hechos a el repositorio. (Solo en ingles)

TutorialsDescription.english: All sort of tutorials introducing you on how to make a mod in Unity.
TutorialsDescription.spanish: Todo tipo de tutoriales explicandote como hacer un mod en Unity.

EntityGuideDescription.spanish: Guia en el uso de las entidades de Unity.

CreditsWrong.english: If any of these links fails or you consider your name should be there let us know.
CreditsWrong.spanish: Si alguno de estos enlaces falla o consideras que tu nombre deberia estar ahi dejanos saber.

valve_expansions_1.english: Install the Visual Studio 2022 re-distributable. You can find it in the `unity/redist` directory.

valve_expansions_2.english: Install the .NET 6 SDK which includes the runtime. Make sure to install the latest version as the runtime is updated regularly.

valve_expansions_3.english: Switch Half-Life to the `steam_legacy` branch. The Unified SDK has not been updated to the anniversary version and requires the old version. This is only required during installation; after installation you can switch back to the anniversary version.

valve_expansions_4.english: Run the tool in a command line window:

content_installer_1.english: The Content Installer tool is used to copy, convert and upgrade Half-Life game assets for a mod installation.

content_installer_2.english: This will copy campaign, training and multiplayer maps and apply any necessary upgrades and bug fixes.

content_installer_3.english: It will also install a default `config.cfg` with correct key bindings if there is none in the mod directory.

content_installer_5.english: If provided no file changes will be written to disk

content_installer_9.english: You can optionally provide `--dry-run` to see which files would be copied without actually making any changes.

worldspawn::mapcfg::description.english: The json file defined for configuration, the path is within cfg/maps/ no need to specify .json, if not defined is maps/mapname.json

player_respawn::classname::description.english: Re-spawn players and relocates them in a valid spawnpoint, don't set any spawnflags for targetting the activator player only.

player_respawn::target::description.english: Fire this target for each not-respawned players and pass them as activator

ammo_all::note_1.english: Combine with `trigger_changekeyvalue` to dynamically change ammo type

BaseCharger::fire_on_recharge::descripti.english: Target to trigger when the charger recharges itself

BaseCharger::fire_on_empty::description.english: Target to trigger when the charger runs out of juice

BaseCharger::fire_on_spawn::description.english: Whether to fire the `fire_on_recharge` target when the charger initially spawns

BaseCharger::total_juice::description.english: Custom amount of juice in this charger. A value of **-1** enables unlimited juice. If not specified the amount specified in the skill configuration is used

BaseCharger::recharge_delay::description.english: Custom recharge delay. A value of **-1** disables recharging. If not specified the amount specified in the skill configuration is used

BaseCharger::charge_per_use::description.english: Amount of juice to discharge per interval. Default **1**. If set to **0** the charger will never discharge

Monster::health.english: Custom health (leave undefined to use default)

Breakable::spawnobject::description.english: Name of the item to spawn when this entity is broken. Only items can be spawned by this entity. This includes all weapons, ammo and all item entities except CTF items.

func_friction::classname.english: Surface with a change in friction

func_rotating::spawnorigin.english: X Y Z - Move here after lighting

game_text::fadein.english: Fade in Time (or character scan time)

item_battery::armor_amount.english: Amount Of Armor To Give (-1 == Maximum)

item_healthkit::health_amount.english: Amount Of Health To Give (-1 == Maximum)

logic_campaignselect::classname.english: Shows the campaign select menu on trigger (hlu_campaignselect map only)

logic_isskill::classname.english: Fires a target based on the current skill level

logic_setskill::classname.english:
Set skill level to specified value
Some variables require a map change to take effect

logic_setskill::classname::description.english: Changes the skill level setting. Due to how the skill system works some changes will only take effect after a map change.This entity is the equivalent of Quake 1's `trigger_setskill` but is a point entity that needs to be triggered. Its intended purpose is to be used in a campaign selection map.

logic_setskillvar::classname.english: Set skill variables to a provided value

BaseOsprey::initial_capacity::descriptio.english: If set, this is the number of troops the Osprey will drop when it starts moving (up to **4** at a time). Otherwise the Osprey will count the number of troops in the map and will replenish them when they are killed. In both cases the Osprey will drop up to a maximum of **24** troops and will wait until they are killed to drop more

monster_tentacle::height0::description.english: Sets the height for the given floor level. There are **4** levels, starting at **0**. See the TWHL documentation for the default values.

monster_tentacle::height1::description.english: Sets the height for the given floor level. There are **4** levels, starting at **0**. See the TWHL documentation for the default values.

monster_tentacle::height2::description.english: Sets the height for the given floor level. There are **4** levels, starting at **0**. See the TWHL documentation for the default values.

monster_tentacle::height3::description.english: Sets the height for the given floor level. There are **4** levels, starting at **0**. See the TWHL documentation for the default values.

trigger_entity_condition::classname.english: Fires a target based on whether the activator match the condition

trigger_entity_condition::condition::2::.english: Checks if it's a player and if it haves the weapon listed in argument_1, supports item_longjump, if argument_1 is empty we'll check if the player have any weapon.

player_sethealth::classname::description.english: This entity allows level designers to change the activating player's health and/or armor.

player_sethealth::set_health::descriptio.english: Whether to set the player's health

player_sethealth::set_armor::description.english: Whether to set the player's armor

player_sethealth::health_to_set::descrip.english: Amount to set the player's health to. Must be in the range **[1, 100]**

player_sethealth::armor_to_set::descript.spanish: Amount to set the player's armor to. Must be in the range **[0, 100]**

player_sethudcolor::classname.english: Set or reset player hud color

player_setcrosshaircolor::classname.english: Set or reset player crosshair color

player_setsuitlighttype::all_players::de.english: Whether to affect all players or the activating player

player_weaponstrip::classname::descripti.english:
Strip individual weapons ammo and items by key 'weapon_357' value 'target to fire if striped'
ammo and weapons are special and can be matched as 'ammo_*' or 'weapon_*'

player_weaponstrip::spawnflags::1::descr.english: If this flag bit is not set, the whole ammo, weapons suit and longjump will be removed

point_teleport::classname.english: Teleport target to this entity on trigger

trigger_usevalue::classname::description.english: Fire true o false whatever the value received is the one specified

trigger_usevalue::max_health::0::descrip.english: Both values are converted into integer before the comparision

trigger_usevalue::max_health::1::descrip.english: Both values are converted into float before the comparision

trigger_entity_iterator::trigger_after_r.english: Trigger at end of each Run

AllocNewActivator::m_Activator::descript.english:
A targetname of a entity or either a special name
!activator = current activator
!caller = current caller
!this = current entity
!player = Nearest player

trigger_eventhandler::classname::descrip.english: Handles a game event and trigger it's target if matched
